title: Who is the best melody writer in music? - Quora

response.answer_text: There really isn’t an objective way to answer this question, as it will depend on personal taste—and the genre of music chosen. There is a very large difference between melodies expressed in jazz and in classical music, for example. When it comes to classical music, for me, the finest writer of melody is Mozart. However, other people who listen to a great deal of classical music may well choose another composer—Beethoven or Bach, for instance, and I would not be able to argue with them sensibly.

Burt Bacharach. He has had countless hits spanning over decades by dozens of recording artists. Carole King. Lots of great songs. Her Tapestry LP is among the greatest albums ever recorded. John Lennon. Not much needs to be said. From rockers, ballads to the whimsical. There will never be another like him. Not even Paul McCartney.
